Title.evidence: Background: This study aimed to evaluate the role of the SAMe-TT 2 R 2 score in the prediction of anticoagulation control after mechanical mitral valve replacement.

Participants.evidence: We retrospectively reviewed clinical data of 160 patients who received mechanical mitral valve replacement at Beijing Anzhen Hospital from January to December 2013.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the role of the SAMe-TT 2 R 2 score in the prediction of anticoagulation control after mechanical mitral valve replacement.

Method_Outcome.evidence: When the cut-off value of the SAMe-TT 2 R 2 score was set to ≥4, the sensitivity and specificity of predicting Time in Therapeutic Range (TTR) ≥65% were 69.8% and 93.1%, respectively.

Number_Analysed.evidence: We retrospectively reviewed clinical data of 160 patients who received mechanical mitral valve replacement at Beijing Anzhen Hospital from January to December 2013.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The Area Under the Curve (AUC) was 0.854.
